bibl.title: Letter from Luis Espinosa y G. Caceres to Philip Showalter Hench, April 13, 1945

div1.p: Espinosa is sorry that his letter to Hench was mistranslated and caused confusion. He is pleased that Hench will return to Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Luis Espinosa y G. Caceres to Philip Showalter Hench, April 13, 1945
div1.opener:
REPUBLICA DE CUBA
-----
MINISTERIO DE SALUBRIDAD Y ASISTENCIA SOCIAL
-------
I N S T I T U T O F I N L A Y
-----
Havana,
April 13, 1945.
R/S # 125
AL CONTESTAR CONSIGNESE FECHA Y NUMERO
DE ESTA COMUNICACION.
EN CADA ESCRITO T R A T E S E DE UN S O L O
ASUNTO.
Lt. Col., M.C. Philip S. Hench
Chief of the Medical Service
Army & Navy General Hospital
Hot Springs National Park,
Arkansas.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
I have just received your kind letter of March 31st.
and I hasten to answer it. It is a pleasure to do so and I al-
though I do not know you personally, but through references, I -
have a great esteem for you. I am sorry, for this reason, that
I have been the cause of a confusion by your translators in re-
gard to an expression of mine.

I am very pleased to know that you plan to come a--
gain to Havana. I can assure you that it will afford me the --
greatest pleasure to have the privilege of extending to you, --
personally, all the attentions to which you are entitled.

With renewed assurance of very sincere personal re-
gards, I am

closer.signed:
Luis Espinosa y G. Cáceres, M.D.
DIRECTOR DE LA DIVISION DE RELACIONES
MEDICAS Y SANITARIAS PANAMERICANAS
